title: English into Spanish percentage
content: Hi, I need to calculate the length of an english text once it has been translated into spanish. I know there is a percentage (+10% ?), but I can't remember it. The inverse percentage (spanish into english), should also be usefull. Thanks
author: anonymous

comments.content:
It depends on different things, like the nature of the text, and the expertise of the translator.   
   
According to Maxim Zhukov's "Typographica Polyglotta", Spanish is about 15% longer then English, assuming a squeaky-clean translation. A very good translator recently made a Spanish version of a 2,500-word essay of mine, and he ended up with an impressive 14%.   
   
Whether such percentages are symmetric is a question I haven't figured out yet.   
   
hhp
